short_description: Performs K-Means clustering on a data set
long_description: Finds cluster centroids and assigns data points to clusters using the k-means algorithm.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.description: Input table is the table containing the list of features by which we are clustering the data.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.description: Output table is the table where output is stored. The output table contains the centroids of the clusters.

argument_clauses.name: ClusteredOutput
argument_clauses.description: An output table containing the assigned cluster id for each data point.

argument_clauses.name: InitialSeeds
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the list of initial seed means (otherwise, a random choice is made as specified in algorithm description). Must be provided as strings of underscore delimited (_) double values.

argument_clauses.name: NumClusters
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of clusters to generate from the data. The input value must be greater than 0.

argument_clauses.name: CentroidsTable
argument_clauses.description: The table that contains the initial seed means for the clusters.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.description: This is the convergence threshold. When the centroids move by less than this amount, the algorithm has converged. The input value must be no less than 0.0. The default value is 0.0395.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.description: This is the maximum number of iterations that the algorithm will run before quitting if the convergence threshold has not been met. The input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: UnpackColumns
argument_clauses.description: Indicates whether the cluster centroids should be output as one column per dimension or as a single column. The default value is false.

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.description: Sets a random seed for the algorithm. The input value must be no less than 0.
